Clip.Title: AERIAL AMERICA
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Zoom above some of America's greatest landcapes and monuments in stunning HD realism.

Clip.Title: BLONDIE'S NEW YORK
Clip.EpisodeSummary: In the span of just a few years, Blondie went from a band fighting for punk cred at CBGB to international superstardom, thanks in large part to one album: Parallel Lines. What was the secret behind its success? How did it all come together...and nearly fall apart? Enter the recording studio with Blondie's frontwoman and namesake, Debbie Harry, the rest of the band, and producer Mike Chapman. Their conversations reveal the real stories behind iconic hits like "Heart of Glass" and "One Way or Another" and how they launched punk music into the mainstream.

Clip.Title: AERIAL AMERICA
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From its Great Lakes to its Grand Canyon, its Rocky Mountain peaks to its Key West reefs, America is a land of amazing destinations. This aerial adventure over the nation's most remarkable landscapes and landmarks captures the breathtaking beauty of America, while demonstrating how its sense of wonder has inspired countless artists, thinkers, and revolutionaries.

Clip.Title: AERIAL AMERICA
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Zoom above some of America's greatest landcapes and monuments in stunning HD realism.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The Eastern Coastline of New Brunswick is an ecological wonder- this aerial survey soars above incredible rock formations, peat farms, and some of the East Coast's most impressive sand dunes.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: BC's inland waterways are a remote wonder - from Knight Inlet and Klinaklini glacier, to Rivers Inlet, and the rainforests surrounding Denny Island.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: A journey along Nova Scotia's Bay of Fundy coastline is a cultural and geological marvel - from historic Acadian Villages, to world-famous stone formations - rising from the sea.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: BC's inland waterways are a remote wonder - from Knight Inlet and Klinaklini glacier, to Rivers Inlet, and the rainforests surrounding Denny Island.

Clip.Title: SKY VIEW
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Soar over Europe and experience the landscape from an eagle's perspective. This remarkable series uses the latest HD and camera mount technology to give the audience a view of Europe and its history that will takes their breath away.

Clip.Title: CANADA 1812: FORGED IN FIRE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Half Cherokee and half Scottish, John Norton leads Six Nations warriors against the invading Americans.

Clip.Title: CANADA 1812: FORGED IN FIRE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: An east coast shipper creates a private naval fleet to seize American ships.

Clip.Title: ASIA'S MONARCHIES
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Journey to the heart of these beautiful lands to understand the relationship between the people and their monarchs.

Clip.Title: MAKING MAO
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Making Mao revisits the people and events responsible for making Mao Zedong the star of this Communist propaganda cultural phenomenon.

Clip.Title: LINCOLN'S WASHINGTON AT WAR
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Washington, D.C. in 1861. The Civil War is at the doorstep and the city is bracing for disaster. America is a country torn in two. An untested President Lincoln strives to make the nation's capital the political center of the Union, but finds he is surrounded by Southern sympathies and under constant threat of attack.

Clip.Title: ASIA'S MONARCHIES
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Journey to the heart of these beautiful lands to understand the relationship between the people and their monarchs.
